qas.question: WHen was the period of Division?
What stemmed the period of division?

answers.text: Bolesław III's division of Poland among his sons

qas.question: What tribe was the prior social structure from?
WHen did the Piast dynasty appear?
Polish nation ruled by what dynasty?

context: The Period of Division from, <a0_0>A.D., 1138 – A.D., 1314<a0_0/>, which included nearly 200 years of feudal fragmentation and which stemmed from <a1_0>Bolesław III's division of Poland among his sons<a1_0/>, was the genesis of the social structure which saw the economic elevation of the great landowning feudal nobles (możni/Magnates, both ecclesiastical and lay) from the rycerstwo they originated from. The prior social structure was one of <a2_0>Polish<a2_0/> tribes united into the historic Polish nation under a state ruled by the <a4_0>Piast dynasty,<a4_0/> this dynasty appearing circa <a3_0>850 A.D.
